channel.title: Puffin on Claire Radel Fans
channel.description: Recent content in Puffin on Claire Radel Fans

item.title: Designated Seer
item.description: Designated Seer # The Guide Dog Sara sat in one of the quieter parts of the nightclub, watching what went on elsewhere.

item.title: Emma's Travels
item.description: Emma’s Travels # Shipwreck Emma Stevens stood on deck of the liner, leaning on the rail and looking into the distance, her long ginger-blonde hair flapping and flailing in the wind, but not getting in her eyes at all; being as she wore glasses, not for the purpose of preventing this but simply so she could see into the distance.

item.title: Librarian Girl
item.description: Librarian Girl # One fine day in spring I went along to the local Library to browse through the books.

item.title: The Voyage Home
item.description: The Voyage Home # Sara walked down the stairs from her first-floor flat to her front door, opened it and went outside.

item.title: Arms and the Woman
item.description: Arms and the Woman # The Cave Meeting Well, there I was waiting for some help.

item.title: At the Doctor
item.description: At the Doctor # I was sitting in the Doctor’s waiting room when the door opened wide, allowing a young woman to enter: she was about five and a half feet tall, and heavily built.

item.title: Top Story
item.description: Top Story # Nancy Woods was the lead presenter of the local 6 o’clock TV News Broadcast.

item.title: Dragonslayer
item.description: Some of the most important parts of Draconic legend are these: their eyes can hypnotise, and although very hard to slay, they have but one vital spot…

item.title: The Gymnasium
item.description: The Gymnasium # Miranda stepped out of the changing rooms into the gymnasium hall proper, dressed in her figure-hugging leotard: she was 14 years old, possessed of a gymnast’s typical slender, lithe build and a suitable smile, good at her art, but the two small red marks on each side of her pretty nose revealed a problem: outside of this hall, she wore glasses.

item.title: The Three Daughters of King El-Kalipha
item.description: The Three Daughters of King El-Kalipha # There was once a great king of Arabia called El-Kalipha, who had three daughters.

item.title: Anna's Tale
item.description: Anna’s Tale # If you have time, I’ll tell you about Anna.

item.title: At the Optician
item.description: At the Optician # My eyes opened as I took in my next patient: she was young, about 20 or 21, I think, and quite pretty, not that tall, but she wore glasses that I could see were around the minus 12 mark.

item.title: Crime and Punishment
item.description: Crime and Punishment # Misuse of Assets Cheryl Barker, or “Cherry” as she liked to be known, was quite a girl: spirited and feisty, one who could be relied on to make people smile with delight, especially if one happened to be male.

item.title: The Phantom Glasses Stealer of Old London Town
item.description: The Phantom Glasses Stealer of Old London Town # In the Park I was in the local park one day in mid-September, enjoying a bit of Autumnal sunshine and warmth as I walked around rather aimlessly.

item.title: Encounter at the Cafe
item.description: Encounter at the Cafe # It was one bright sunny day when I walked into the cafe, thereupon I saw this lovely woman lounging on one of the chairs by an outside table: I quickly noted that she wore glasses and had wonderfully long legs.

item.title: Jewel of the Jungle
item.description: Jewel of the Jungle # The Council Jaya looked at the fuzzy faces around her: the leaders of her tribe were discussing the problems they faced and what to do about them.

item.title: The Gift
item.description: The Gift # I remember my first day working at the bank: my job was to serve the general public, not a wonderful job, but a job nonetheless.

item.title: The Wrong Place
item.description: The Wrong Place # Alison sat on the corner of her bed contemplating her face at close range in a mirror, and her ill fortune over a longer perspective.

item.title: The Talisman
item.description: The Talisman # Discovery Sarah had been fat and in need of glasses for as long as she could remember.

item.title: Darkness And Silence All Over The World
item.description: Darkness and Silence All Over the World # Day of Infamy November 14th, 2003 will go down in history as “another Pearl Harbor”, when the Lizards came from a world many light years distant and tried to take over our Earth.

item.title: Survival
item.description: Survival # Solitude The starship dropped out of what could be called warpdrive.

item.title: Dolphin Dance
item.description: Dolphin Dance # I was on holiday last year in California, during which one day I went to a sealife centre to watch the dolphins: I really like dolphins, they’re so clever and fun, and seem to really enjoy their carefree existence.

item.title: Glasses from the Gods
item.description: Glasses from the Gods # My name is Mark Smith.

item.title: Princess of the Plains
item.description: Lyra Starfire and the Legion of Space # Episode 16: Princess of the Plains # Prologue

item.title: Helpless
item.description: Helpless # A tall man sauntered casually though the well-appointed hotel dining room towards the patio: it was early morning, the sun low in the sky, too early for breakfast.

item.title: Be Careful Who You Pick Up
item.description: Be Careful Who You Pick Up # I was on the road one day, and passed through this small village in the countryside.

item.title: Shooting Star
item.description: Shooting Star # I was at the gun club one Saturday afternoon when I saw this young woman of about 22 or 23 go into the slot next to me: she wasn’t very tall, say only 5'2" or so, but was quite slim and pretty.

item.title: Symphony of Sight
item.description: I Adagio-Allegro ma non troppo

item.title: The Angel
item.description: The Angel # The Girl and the Teacher There once was this girl at school called Kerry: she was eight years old, not particularly remarkable, but come to that neither was I, but the one thing that set her apart was her thick glasses.

item.title: The Raven
item.description: Hold the Thin End I remember the first time I saw Susan Rogers, otherwise known as Raven Rogers or simply “the Raven”: such a nickname was apt because she had long black hair, but also her tennis skills, which enabled her to beat anyone else quite easily.

item.title: Rescue Me
item.description: Rescue Me # Debra stood on the narrow parapet outside her apartment window: ten floors up ought to be enough to end it all, she had thought.

item.title: The Painter
item.description: The Painter # I decided that I needed something to do in the evenings, other than watch TV or mess around with the Internet, so I joined an art class at a local college.

item.title: Two is Too Many
item.description: Two is Too Many # When Saturday Comes Celia was a lovely, tall, slim, bubbly, confident woman of 28 years who worked at a local hotel as a receptionist.

item.title: A Christmas Carol
item.description: A Christmas Carol # Out Shopping I was in a local department store, checking out possibilities for some last minute and hence urgent Christmas shopping, trying to decide what was best.

item.title: Eye Robot
item.description: Eye Robot # This story is set in the same universe as that of Lyra Starfire.

item.title: Give Blood
item.description: Missing I worked at the local hospital in the clerical support team, checking stock inventories, ordering supplies, making sure that when the surgeons did their work, there were appropriate consumables ready for them to use.

item.title: Missing the Barn Door
item.description: Missing the Barn Door # I was scanning through the latest list of eligible young ladies the dating agency had sent me: one in particular caught my eye.

item.title: No Good Choices
item.description: Growth Annabelle was, and I think still very much is a lovely girl, tall, slim and pretty, kind and friendly by nature.

item.title: The Model
item.description: The Model # One day I was in town wandering around in the local shopping mall about lunchtime: there was the usual mixture of overpriced shops selling clothes, CD’s and many other things I didn’t really want.

item.title: I dreamt of a Wolf
item.description: I Dreamt of a Wolf # I remember very well seeing Emma for the first time.

item.title: The Phantom
item.description: The Phantom # I work at the regional Police HQ: not as part of the police force, but as civilian support in the computer department.

item.title: The Worlds of Gail
item.description: The Worlds of Gail # Alone in the World The first time I saw Gail was at the orphanage: we were both in the unhappy position of having been orphaned at a particularly young age, and had ended up here in this big, foreboding house that once was a stately home, but now was used as a house-cum-school for around a hundred young kids like me and her, between the ages of four and ten.

item.title: A Minor Miracle
item.description: A Minor Miracle # The young woman rummaged through the pile of junk.

item.title: The Wishing Well
item.description: The Wishing Well # 1: Desire

item.title: Opening the Door
item.description: Opening the Door # Secret Life It’s a bit hard to sum up my life with Laura Jameson: she was quite a bit younger when I first met her a few years ago, a fairly tall young woman of 22, not quite skinny but certainly having curves in all the right places.

item.title: Flame of Life
item.description: Flame of Life # Arrival Liana stopped her horse and squinted ahead.

item.title: Dear Diary VI
item.description: Dear Diary VI # January Part I

item.title: Dear Diary V
item.description: Dear Diary V # January Kirsty sat on the bed in her bedroom, which looked considerably better than her old bedroom at her mother’s house, even considering that some of the time she couldn’t see it very well, which was in former times thanks to imperfectly corrected vision.

item.title: Dear Diary IV
item.description: Dear Diary IV # January On the morning of the first of January, a Saturday, Kirsty wrote ‘Dear Diary, let me introduce myself.

item.title: Dear Diary III
item.description: Dear Diary III # January Early in January, Kirsty sat on the bus: she was travelling homeward from the opticians with a little smile on her face.

item.title: Dear Diary II
item.description: Dear Diary II # January Kirsty walked slowly around the ladies clothes section of Lacey’s: a large department store, in which normally she’d be only slightly interested being as the fashions there were quite old and a bit dowdy, being the sort of things she in her youth considered entirely suitable for middle aged women, or her mother more specifically.

item.title: Dear Diary I
item.description: Dear Diary # April Kirsty dumped her school bag by the door of her small bedroom and sighed, sat on her bed, kicked off her shoes, then lay back on her bed staring up at the ceiling.

item.title: Fog of War
item.description: Well, here is a story I’ve been wanting to write for some time, it’s set in the far future and concerns a fictional heroine “Lyra Starfire” - she’s been mentioned in some older stories of mine - and this time we finally get to meet her.

item.title: What Sally Saw
item.description: Here is another new story by me:

item.title: The Rampant Horse
item.description: Again, being as this is a new message board and it has some need of attention, I have written a new story for the occasion.

item.title: Four Eyed Angel
item.description: No glasses discussion board should be without this classic story, the one that got me going.
